item.title: 2026 McKinney Writing Contest is open!
item.description: The 2026 McKinney Writing Contest is open from November 1, 2025 through March 9, 2026. Submit in any or all of the following categories: Fiction, Creative Nonfiction, or Drama; Poetry; Academic Essay; Language & Image; or our NEW category: Writing for Games. Undergraduate and graduate divisions. First prize $300; 2nd prize $175; and 3rd prize $75. Submit: https://hass.rpi.edu/mckinney. Submit in fall for December graduates. Questions? McKinney@rpi.edu

item.title: Schmidt Science Fellowship Seeking Applicants for Prestigious Post-doctoral Fellowship
item.description: Fellows receive $110K per year for two years, are placed at an internationally prestigious lab, and are mentored by world leaders in science and industry. PhD students graduating between May 2026 and June 2027 who are interested in developing skills in a discipline different than their own should contact Betty Madigan, madige@rpi.edu, by April 10th for information on the internal selection process. A committee will select 2 nominees to be submitted in May. Questions? madige@rpi.edu

item.title: Financial Research Resources Available to All RPI Students
item.description: All RPI students have access to financial research tools through the Lally School of Management, including Bloomberg, FactSet, S&P Capital IQ, Wharton Research Data Services (WRDS), and more. Visit the Lally website to learn more about available resources and how to access them.

item.title: City Station West Housing Update
item.description: City Station West will continue to operate independently from RPI and lease primarily to RPI students. Juniors, seniors, and graduate students who have fulfilled their on-campus housing requirement may lease directly with City Station West as an off-campus option. However, City Station West will no longer be included in Student Living and Learning’s housing inventory or appear on RPI housing applications beginning with Summer and Fall 2026.

item.title: Prepare for the Career Fair with PCA’s (and pizza!)
item.description: Join us for an informative and interactive session hosted by your peers working in the Career Center! Our team of experienced student advisors will share valuable tips and strategies on how to prepare effectively for a career fair. Whether you’re fine-tuning your resume, crafting an elevator pitch, or deciding what to wear, this event will help you feel confident and prepared. Bring your questions and get ready to walk into the career fair with confidence! Free pizza provided!

item.title: ASCE Student Chapter Meeting
item.description: Date: Thursday, February 5, 2026 6:00 PM - 7:00 PM - Join fellow students for a presentation by RPI adjunct professor Marc Tartarsky. Prof Tartarsky will highlight Arup’s structural engineering program and discuss some of their current projects. Arup is an international design, engineering, architecture, and planning firm. Pizza will be provided.

item.title: Regeneron seeking nominees for Annual Prize for Creative Innovation
item.description: Regeneron seeks to award creativity and innovation in the biomedical sciences with an unrestricted check for $50,000 and an invitation to present a project at Regeneron’s headquarters. Up to 10 finalists will receive a $5,000 award. Rensselaer will select 2 PhD students and 2 post-docs from any discipline for nomination. Contact this office (madige@rpi.edu) for full details and instructions to submit for the internal selection process. Applications will be due to OGE by February 15th.

item.title: Study Abroad Application Portal Open!
item.description:
Are you an undergraduate student who is ready to study abroad? The application portal for summer/fall ’26 & AY ’26-’27 is open! Application deadlines are March 1 for affiliated exchanges and April 1 for non-affiliated study abroad. Visit the Education Abroad website for more information and application instructions: https://isss.rpi.edu/education-abroad/program-information/application-process-and-deadlines. Have questions? Contact Karen Dvorak, Education Abroad Program Manager, dvorak2@rpi.edu.
